block.p: CHAPPAQUA -- Chappaqua Drama Group presents ''The Miracle Worker'' by William Gibson. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $16; teenagers 13 through 18 and people 65 and older, $14. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. 238-5003.

CHAPPAQUA -- Chappaqua Drama Group presents ''The Miracle Worker'' by William Gibson. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $16; teenagers 13 through 18 and people 65 and older, $14. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. 238-5003.

CROTON FALLS -- ''Abundance'' by Beth Henley. Today at 4 p.m. and Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through June 11. Tickets: $17; Thursday evenings only, $14. The Schoolhouse, Owens Rd. 277-8477. ELMSFORD -- The musical ''Grease.'' Wednesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6 and Sundays at 7 p.m., with dinner at 5. Matinees: Wednesdays and Thursdays at 1 p.m., with lunch at 11:30 a.m. and Sundays at 1:30 p.m., with lunch at noon. Through June 24. Tickets: $46 to $66, with discounts at selected performances for children, students and older people. Westchester Broadway Theater, 1 Broadway Plaza. 592-2222. GARRISON -- ''Quilters,'' play performed by Philipstown Players. Today at 5 p.m., next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday 5 p.m. Depot Theater, Garrison Landing. 265-2797. IRVINGTON -- ''Sibling Revelry,'' starring Ann Hampton Callaway and Liz Callaway. Evening benefiting Hudson Stage Company. Host, Meredith Vieira of ''The View'' on ABC. Tonight at 7. Tickets: $50 and $75, including reception after performance. (All but $10 tax deductible.) Irvington Town Hall Theater, 85 Main Street. 591-6602. PURCHASE -- Play Group Theater for Children and Young Adults performing ''The Little Prince,'' musical based on the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery. Today and next Sunday at 1 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $15; students and older people, $12; children, $10. Little Theater, Manhattanville College. 946-0649. YONKERS -- Actors Conservatory Theater presents the musical ''The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $16; people 62 and older, $14. Bryn Mawr Park Presbyterian Church, Lockwood Avenue. 352-8307.

BEDFORD -- Empire Brass, performing brass quintet music ranging from Renaissance to Duke Ellington. Presented by Mount Kisco Concert Association. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $25. Fox Lane High School, Route 172. 666-9181. DOBBS FERRY -- Gerald Robbins, pianist, performing works by Beethoven, Debussy and Schumann. Presented by Hudson Valley Music Club. Tomorrow at 1 p.m. Tickets: $12, including reception after program. 54 Clinton Avenue. 591-6434. ELMSFORD -- Herb Reed's Platters, singing ''Only You,'' ''The Great Pretender,'' ''My Prayer'' and other hits. Tuesday at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6. Tickets: $55. Westchester Broadway Theater, 1 Broadway Plaza. 592-2222. KATONAH -- ''Performer's Showcase,'' continuing brief recitals and tours of museum. Wednesdays at 11 a.m. Tickets: $11 each; Friends of Caramoor, $9. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road. 232-5035. MOUNT KISCO -- ''Simple Gifts,'' concert exploring the influence of folk, ethnic and children's music on classical composers. Presented by Music from the Copland House, the resident chamber ensemble at Copland's restored home in Cortlandt. Today at 3 p.m. Free. Mount Kisco Public Library, 100 Main Street. 666-8041. NYACK -- African, jazz, pop and Latin rhythms by Toby Foyeh and Orchestra Africa. Today 5:30 p.m. Tickets: $20. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. 358-6333. PEEKSKILL -- Jazz saxophonist, Dave Finucane, and His Quartet. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $10. One Station Plaza, 38 North Division Street. 736-1053. PURCHASE -- ''Sex, Love and Barber,'' Westchester Philharmonic, with violinist, Pamela Frank, in a program of Tchaikowsky, Liszt, Bartok and Barber; Paul Lustig Dunkel, conductor. Today at 3 p.m., with June LeBell interviewing Pamela Frank at 1:45. Tickets: $29 to $39. Performing Arts Center, Purchase College. 682-3707, ext. 10. RYE -- United States Military Academy Band from West Point performing light classics and marches in the style of John Philip Sousa. Sponsored by Pulvermann Foundation. Today at 3 p.m. Free. Rye High School, Parsons Street. 337-4034. SCARSDALE -- Guest soloists, orchestra and parish choir perform works by Mozart, Handel and others. Presented in celebration of church's 150th anniversary. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $30. Church of St. James the Less, Church Lane at Crane Road. 723-6100. VALHALLA -- Bloomfield Mandolin Orchestra plays classics by Verdi, Mascagni, Tchaikovsky and DeCurtis. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $10. Academic Arts Theater, Westchester Community College. 785-6790. YONKERS -- Mamaroneck Wind Ensemble. Today at noon. Free. Bronx River Parkway Reservation, Scarsdale Road. 242-7275. YORKTOWN HEIGHTS -- Taconic Opera and full orchestra performing Mozart's ''Cosi Fan Tutte''; Dan Montez, director, in futuristic version set on another planet and with supertitles. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $32 to $47, with discounts for students and older people. Yorktown Stage, 1974 Commerce Street. 739-2165.

CHAPPAQUA -- Ruthanne Lum McCunn talks of the ''Many Faces of Chinese Americans, 1900 to the Present.'' Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. 238-4779. HARRISON -- ''Planning for the 21st Century,'' an estate planning day with round-table discussions. Presented by Arthritis Foundation, Hudson Valley Branch. Wednesday at 1 to 4 p.m. Free. Willow Ridge Country Club, 123 North Street. 683-0842. MOUNT KISCO -- Poetry reading by Paul Violi. Followed by open mike. Tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. Suggested donation: $7; students and people 62 and older, $5. Northern Westchester Center for the Arts, 272 North Bedford Road. 241-6922. OSSINING -- ''Downtown,'' local merchants reminisce about the late-19th- and 20th-century businesses on Main and Spring Streets. Presented by Ossining Historical Society Museum and library. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Ossining Public Library, 53 Croton Avenue. 941-2416. WHITE PLAINS -- Informal discussion of Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorders by Dr. Jeanne Greenblatt. Thursday at 7:15 p.m. Auditorium of White Plains Hospital. 278-3020.

ELMSFORD -- ''Captured Beauty,'' photography by Steve Lipkin. Through May. Greenburgh Town Hall, Tarrytown Road and Hartsdale Avenue. 422-1038. HARRISON -- ''Sensuous Still Lifes,'' paintings by Joy Tobin. Through June 3. Harrison Public Library, Bruce Avenue. 835-0324. MAMARONECK -- ''Art at the Harbor,'' local artists sell their work and paint on location. Sponsored by Village Arts Council. Today from noon to 4 p.m., with children's workshop on the beach at 1:30 p.m. (Children should bring a plastic recyclable item to use in workshop). Free. Rain or shine. Harbor Island Park, Mamaroneck Avenue and Boston Post Road. 698-0872. NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Westchester Biennial 2000,'' juried exhibition with works by Renata Rainer, Grace Powers, Yechiam Gal, Rosalind Schneider, Marcy B. Freedman and others. Through June 11. Castle Gallery, College of New Rochelle. 654-5235. PELHAM -- ''Family Ties,'' exhibition turning artists' family experiences into collective storytelling. Through June 10. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. 738-2525. PLEASANTVILLE -- Retrospective of art by Raymond deLucia. Opening reception today from 2 to 4 p.m. Through June 23. Mount Pleasant Public Library, 350 Bedford Road. 769-0548. SHRUB OAK -- Oils, watercolors, woodcuts and photography by Ruth Kayser. Through Friday. John C. Hart Memorial Library, 1130 Main Street. 245-5262.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''Animals and Acrobats Festival,'' a 19th-century-style traveling road show, featuring musicians, magician, juggler, rope walker, storyteller, puppeteer, Paul Peabody's marionettes and elephant and camel rides. Next Saturday through May 29 from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $8; people 60 and older, $7; children 5 through 17, $4; younger children, free. Animal rides, additional $4 each. Sale of picnic foods, with picnicking welcome. Van Cortlandt Manor, off Route 9. 271-8981. GREENBURGH -- ''Nature Bugs,'' nature discovery program for children 3 and 4 and accompanying adult. Continuing Mondays (except May 29) from 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Rain or shine. Cost: $4; children, $3. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. 723-3470. OSSINING -- Children watch a brief slide show, then hike to a vernal pond teeming with frogs, toads and other amphibians. Next Saturday, with children 8 and 9 from 10 a.m. to noon and children 10 through 12 from 1 to 3 p.m. Cost: $8; members, $6. Registration. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. 762-2912. RYE -- Playland Park's hours: Today from noon to 11, Friday from 6 p.m. to midnight, next Saturday from noon to midnight and next Sunday and Memorial Day from noon to 11 p.m. (Summer hours begin June 24.) Free admission. Parking: $7 on holidays; weekends, $5. Ride tickets: $8 for 12-ticket book; 24-ticket book, $15; 36-ticket book, $19. Rides are 3 to 5 tickets each. 925-2700. SOMERS -- Children take part in vegetable and herb gardening and make a garden craft project. Today from noon to 3 p.m. Free. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. 232-7118. TARRYTOWN -- Pretzel-making workshop for children 3 through 12. Thursday at 3:30 p.m. Registration. Warner Library, 121 North Broadway. 631-7734. YONKERS -- Children pose with their families in 19th-century finery. Then create a frame to preserve the memory. Today at 1:30 p.m. Cost: $1 each and museum admission, additional $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. Demonstration of dugout canoe building, using chopping, burning and scraping techniques. Today from noon to 4:30 p.m. Free, with museum admission. ''Start of It All,'' planetarium show for children 10 and older and adults. Friday at 7 p.m. Free. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Ave. 963-4550.
